Just a memo: please refer to [this comment](https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/956#discussion_r13582230) and [SPARK-2094](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-2094) for more details about this PR and PR #956.

@mengxr  actually the unit test for this would look really funky since it's really hard to simulate the case where creationSiteInfo is null (this basically only happens when you deserialize a RDD, where the RDD is created without a call to the constructor, which is the only thing that initializes the creationSiteInfo field under the hood).

Hey @GregOwen a couple thoughts.
1. If you run this in the spark shell you'll get examples than from within the unit test harness. The issue is that the code we use to detect the "call site" of the RDD (the user function that called it) gets messed up when running unit tests because they are within the spark package.
2. I might slightly prefer adding `+` icons next to the main RDD and `|` icons next to the pipelined ones. /cc @rxin also who might have some thoughts on this.

```
(5) + FlatMappedValuesRDD[321] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
    | MappedValuesRDD[320] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
    | CoGroupedRDD[319] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
    (4) + MappedRDD[318] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
        | MappedRDD[316] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
        | ParallelCollectionRDD[314] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
    (5) + MappedRDD[317] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
        | ParallelCollectionRDD[315] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
    (6) + MappedRDD[317] at apply at Transformer.scala:22
```
Merged build finished. All automated tests passed.

Caveat: I had trouble testing this with spot instances. For some reason, even when I set my spot price really high, I could not get Amazon to grant me spot instances. 

So, I expect the instance names to show up correctly with spot instances, but I was not able to test that myself.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
